activities.description: Slow to get out of bed due to stiffness and pain. Takes time to slowly stretch and move before getting up.
activities.notes: Requires extra time due to pain and stiffness. Often has difficulty sleeping so may be fatigued.

activities.description: Basic hygiene and dressing. Shower every other day due to fatigue and pain with overhead movements.
activities.notes: Difficulty with buttons, overhead garments, washing hair. Uses bench in shower. Keeps frequently used items at accessible height.

activities.description: Simple breakfast preparation and eating. Usually cereal, toast, or microwave items.
activities.notes: Avoids cooking that requires standing for extended periods. Has difficulty with some containers and food preparation.

activities.description: Medication routine and preparation for the day.
activities.notes: Uses pill organizer to compensate for memory issues. Reviews schedule for the day.

morningRoutine.assistanceRequired: Occasional help from spouse with difficult clothing items, hair washing, and meal preparation.

weekdaySchedule.description: Light household tasks, checking emails, phone calls related to insurance and appointments.
weekdaySchedule.notes: Paces activities with frequent breaks. Uses written notes to track important call information due to memory issues.
Usually lies down with supportive pillows to relieve neck and back strain.

weekdaySchedule.description: Medical appointments (typically PT 3x weekly) or continued light home activities.
weekdaySchedule.notes: Relies on spouse or family member for transportation to appointments.
Prepares simple meals. Often rests afterward to manage pain and fatigue.

weekdaySchedule.description: Light cognitive activities such as reading, computer use (limited), or watching TV.
weekdaySchedule.notes: Needs to take frequent breaks from screen time due to neck pain. Uses reading stand to avoid looking down.
Pain and fatigue typically peak in afternoon. Nap helps manage evening activities.

weekdaySchedule.description: Light household activities, gentle walking outside if weather permits.
weekdaySchedule.notes: Tries to get some fresh air and gentle movement. Often limited by pain and fatigue.

daytimeActivities.weekendVariations: Weekends follow similar pattern but with more family interaction. Son or spouse often help with household tasks and yard work that patient cannot perform. May have occasional social visits from friends or family members.

activities.notes: Helps with meal preparation but cannot stand for extended periods or lift heavy items. Spouse does most of cooking.
Enjoys family time. Uses cushion for lumbar support while sitting at dining table.

activities.description: Relaxation time with family, watching TV, or gentle conversation.
activities.notes: Uses recliner with heat pad for comfort. Pain often increases as day progresses.

activities.description: Evening hygiene routine and preparation for bed.
activities.notes: Pain and stiffness more pronounced by evening. Takes evening medications.

activities.description: Relaxation techniques, meditation, or reading in bed.
activities.notes: Uses relaxation app to help manage pain and prepare for sleep.

eveningRoutine.sleepEnvironment: Uses multiple pillows for positioning - cervical pillow for neck, body pillow between knees, small lumbar roll. Has sound machine for white noise. Takes sleep aid as needed.

sleepPattern.qualityDescription: Poor and fragmented. Difficulty finding comfortable position. Pain disrupts sleep.
sleepPattern.nighttimeWakings: 3-4 times per night, usually due to pain when changing positions
sleepPattern.morningState: Wakes feeling unrefreshed. Significant stiffness and increased pain in morning.
